title: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
summary: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader[lower-alpha 1] is a high fantasy novel for children by C. S. Lewis, published by Geoffrey Bles in 1952. It was the third published of seven novels in The Chronicles of Narnia (1950â€“1956) and Lewis had finished writing it in 1950, before the first book was out. It is volume five in recent editions, which are sequenced according to the novels' internal chronology. Like the others, it was illustrated by Pauline Baynes and her work has been retained in many later editions.[1][3] It is the only Narnia book that does not have a main villain.
